Summary My roles have included designing highly engaging & immersive products for mobile apps, social platforms and components, web interfaces. 
 
I have an obsessive attention to detail and for establishing synergies within products and between product teams to ensure all aspects of the product life-cycle are aligned with, and exceed, the product and revenue goals. 
 
I am looking to lead a passionate team of designers partnering with talented product owners and engineers in creating world-class products.

The Tabby Awards, the global competition recognizing the best tablet apps and games, has today announced the nominees for its 2015 consumer app competition. Over 200 iPad and Android apps from publishers in 16 countries entered the competition earlier this year. 
 
An international judging panel reviewed these submissions, narrowing the field to a list of 98 nominees across 11 categories for Android apps and games and 23 categories for iPad apps and games. This year, the judging panel is chaired by Otto Toth, tech director of The Huffington Post in New York. 
 
http://tabbyawards.com/winners/2015-best-tablet-apps-ipad-ios-android-winners-users-choice/#ipad-apps 
 
Some comments from judges: 
“Great Sports application with great UI and design. Lots of great content. The UI/UX of the app is world-class. Very easy to use. The score detail page, is very well designed.” Yahoo! Summary Product experience designer and design leader since 14 Yrs for web and mobile products. An ambidextrous practitioner of product design strategy, interaction design, visual design and usability to realize best in the class NextGen apps.  
 
Leading the design for 'Data and Analytics' group in Yahoo Ad Products vertical. I own and manage the e-2-e UX for Yahoo Ad Exchange, RightMedia Exchange, Yahoo Web Analytics, Display Ad Reporting and Flurry Mobile Analytics suit - the largest App analytics suite. Key contributor and driver of NextGen Yahoo Enterprise design language.  
 
Drive the 'design led innovations' with recurring win record in Hack days, competitions and productized many of these as revenue generating streams by leading multi-functional teams. 
 
Earlier, a decade of rich consulting experience for Fortune 100 companies in the area of UX strategy, Design and usability for Banking, Trading, Medical, Education domains. Notably led the 10 member UX team for 4.5 yrs for Citibank.  
 
I hold the masters in design from IIT Mumbai and Exec. General Management ( EGMP ) from IIM Bangalore.

:: Speaker, UX event moderator and UX publication

Summary Life is complicated already. Should products that we use be as well?  
My approach to design is to make the products I create simple & effortless to add value to everyday lives of people.  
 
I believe design goes hand-in-hand with product and engineering, and that’s exactly how I work. I collaborate closely with product, engineering, research, and leadership teams to create designs that focus on the best user experience possible. Summary Life is complicated already. September 2013  – Present (2 years) Sunnyvale Designing the next-generation Yahoo homepage across desktop and mobile devices, primarily focused on the high-performing infinite news feed module and universal header. 
 
1. INFINITE NEWS FEED ON HOMEPAGE 
To seamlessly craft meaningful features into the much loved news feed — to bring in more value to the time users spend on this module and to make it a daily habit. 
Notable latest features:  
• Simple(r) user feedback controls 
• "Stateful" stream: Real-time updates of new content on the homepage, prompting the user to load the newest items. This habit-forming action encourages the user to sign in and increases engagement. 
• Personalization and user on-boarding 
• A meaningful "visited" state with related content 
• News feed interrupters: offering opportunities to the user to shape their interest pool 
• News clustering: Grouping of similar stories together, creating a story line experience 
• Content Diversity 
 
2. YAHOO'S UNIVERSAL HEADER 
To keep the single thread that holds all the Yahoo products together as simple as possible for the users to navigate on desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms. 
Latest additions and improvements: 
• Account switcher: Allows a user to log in and switch between multiple accounts from anywhere on Yahoo 
• Simpler mobile navigation with easy filtering Sr. Interaction Designer Yahoo! Summary Pleasant to eyes, meaningful, self-explanatory, this is what I think a piece of visual communication should be. 
Visual communication is not only building up a pretty image, but it’s about saying something, making people able to interact, to learn, in a way that makes you able to lead, just by giving suggestions. 
 
With a pretty multifaceted background, I’m daily involved in graphic and interaction design projects ready to be delivered across multiple media, from printed materials to video and online visuals, without mentioning user interfaces and CGI artworks. 
 
Focused but really open minded and curious (constantly up to date about technology, visual trends and contemporary art, time permitting), I’m keen on being involved on high impact projects where I can give a demonstration of my attention to details and passion in crossing new boundaries. Summary I am a creative interaction designer with years coding experience in (X)HTML, CSS and basic working knowledge for JQuery and CSS 3 animation and using Adobe Creative Suite. Touching up images in Photoshop, creating vector art in Illustrator and designing high level information architectures and wireframes in OmniGrafe. I have a short experience in programming, using JavaScript and Action Script 3 to engage interaction and functionality. I conduct user experience research on design practices, analysis information, identifying problems, integrating resources, proposing optimum solutions and user-friendly interaction. I am an excellent team player understanding the value of working together towards a common goal. I have a positive personality and I am self-motivated that bright up the working environment and encourage coworkers.

• Interaction design, UX improvement 
• Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch (Application)  
• HTML 5, SASS/LESS, CSS 
• Flow charts & Information Architecture

Summary I started my formal "learning and development" career at Sterling Software in 1992. I began with teaching Windows 3.1 and then moved to Office 4.2 focusing on Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. 
 
In 2000 Computer Associates (CA) acquired Sterling Software. At CA I expanded my facilitation skills by learning Instructional Design.  
 
At CA, in addition to teaching MS Office, I began learning and teaching multiple internal software systems two of which were: CA's Performance Management System and a Contract Management System. In my last nine months at CA I was traveling globally teaching a third-party marketing tool to the Marketing Department and their supporting teams. 
 
Around the same time, due to my project management and writing skills, I also became involved in SOX (Sarbanes Oxley) certification for CA, assisting their European HQ IT Department with their procedures. 
 
I contracted for about one year as an Instructional Designer for Countrywide. 
 
I then became a Technical Training Specialist for Yahoo! Search Marketing, writing and facilitating their Guideline, Content Development, and Customer Solutions Training. 
 
In 2008 I moved to WellPoint, Inc. and was a Lead Sales Trainer for their West and National Accounts Regions. 
 
In 2010 I realized I missed the Internet Business and returned to Yahoo as an Instructional Designer for the Global Sales Learning & Development Team. I have worked on a variety of projects, the two main being: the Search Alliance and our global sales portal. 
 
In 2013 I was promoted to Senior Instructional Designer. 
 
Specialties: Instructional Design 
Training (Soft skills and Hard Skills) 
eLearning 
Project Management

Around the same time, due to my project management and writing skills, I also became involved in SOX (Sarbanes Oxley) certification for CA, assisting their European HQ IT Department with their procedures. 
 
I contracted for about one year as an Instructional Designer for Countrywide. 
 
I then became a Technical Training Specialist for Yahoo! Search Marketing, writing and facilitating their Guideline, Content Development, and Customer Solutions Training.

In 2013 I was promoted to Senior Instructional Designer.

Summary Visual/interaction designer for web, mobile, and desktop products. I currently work on Communications products and initiatives at Yahoo (following its acquisition of Xobni). Before Xobni, I had multi-year stints as the lead visual designer for Yahoo Mail and Yahoo Messenger.  
 
Things I enjoy: whiteboarding and sketching, creating low- and high-fidelity prototypes (HTML/CSS/JS, Objective-C/Swift, paper, Keynote), trying to make things pixel-perfect, hearing feedback from users, seeing products ship.

Xobni was acquired by Yahoo in July 2013. Principal Designer Yahoo March 2001  –  August 2008  (7 years 6 months) From 2006-2008, I was the principal (interaction & visual) designer for Yahoo Messenger's web-based products. I helped define the design framework, built a fully skinnable visual system in Adobe Flex, and spec'ed out and prototyped core product features. I also mentored other designers and contributed to Yahoo's cross-product UX pattern library.  
 
From 2002-2005, I was the lead visual designer for Yahoo Messenger - which included the first visual redesign of the Windows product (6.0) and the reintroduction of voice calling (7.0). I also headed design and front-end development for messenger.yahoo.com across 18 countries. 
 
From 2001-2003, I was the lead visual designer for Yahoo Mail, and worked on the first major redesign of Mail, Calendar, and Address Book. This was one of Yahoo's first global redesigns, was the first major product set to use CSS, and was still Netscape 4 compliant(!) This redesign later morphed into "Yahoo Mail Classic", and was finally retired in July 2013. Senior Designer Spongelab, Inc.
